localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Intl.Collator
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: Intl.Collator constructor

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.realpath
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.realpath. Insure that the correct encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Buffer.allocUnsafeSlow
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS buffer allocation. If text is passed, insure that the buffer is sized correctly for the texts encoding.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: socket.setEncoding
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS socket.setEncoding. It is a good idea to double-check that the correct encoding is set.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: buf.fill
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS buf.fill. If working with strings, then the correct encoding must be passed. Using an offset will need to be done with care, as some characters may require more bytes than others.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: write - generic
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS write methods. Some write methods may be passed an optional encoding. Insure that the encoding is provided if necessary, and that the correct encoding is used.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.appendFileSync
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.appendFileSync. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: push - generic
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS push method. Takes an optional encoding. Insure that the encoding is set correctly.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.readDirSync
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.readDirSync. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: stream transforms
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS stream transforms. Insure that any stream transforms correctly consider the stream's encoding.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.writeFile
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.writeFile. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.realpathSync
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.realpathSync. Insure that the correct encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: buf.copy
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS buf.copy. If copied buffer contains text, then any offset used must be appropriate for the given encoding. It must also account for variable character lengths in utf8/utf16

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: stream.Readable
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS stream.Readable constructor. Takes an optional encoding. Insure that the encoding is set correctly.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: tty.ReadStream
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS tty.ReadStream. Input from terminal is likely to be ascii text. If this input is shown to users, care must be taken to insure that it is locale specific.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Buffer
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS Buffer constructor (deprecated). Buffers must be constructed to be the right size for the encoding used.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: read - generic
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: Looks for all read methods. In NodeJS, read methods may be used to read n bytes. Insure that any n is appropriate for the encoding used, and considers the possibility of variable byte sizes for different unicode characters.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: http request.write
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS http request.write. Insure that the correct encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: punycode.(endcode|decode)
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: The default JavaScript strings passed/retrieved will be in UCS2, which does not support characters on outside the Basic Multilingual Plane.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Buffer read methods
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS buffer read methods, which are encoding sensitive. The encoding(s) used should be double checked for consistency.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.read
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.read. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.watch
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.watch. Insure that the correct filename encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: http response.end
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS http response.end. Insure that the correct encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Buffer.byteLength
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: Nodejs Buffer.byteLength

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: socket.end
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS socket.end. Insure that the correct encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.createWriteStream
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.createWriteStream. Insure that the correct stream encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: socket.write
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS socket.write. Insure that the correct encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: tty.WriteStream
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS tty.WriteStream. If non-ascii input may be written, then insure the tty supports the given character set and encoding.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.createReadStream
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.createReadStream. Insure that the correct stream encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: StringDecoder
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS StringDecoder constructor. You may wish to double check that the correct encoding is being used with the decoder.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.appendFile
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.appendFile. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: os.userInfo
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS os.userinfo. Takes an encoding as an optional parameter. Insure that appropriate encoding is used.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Buffer write methods
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS buffer write methods, which are encoding sensitive. The encoding(s) used should be double checked for consistency.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: buf.includes
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS buf.includes. Takes optional byteOffset and encoding. Insure that a correct encoding is given, and that the byteOffset, if used, accounts for possible extra-wide characters.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.readFile
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.readFile. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.readlinkSync
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.readlinkSync. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.writeFileSync
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.writeFileSync. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: setDefaultEncoding
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS setDefaultEncoding. This method implies i18n consideration, it should be double checked to insure the correct encoding is used.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.readFileSync
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.readFileSync. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.write
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.write. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: end - generic
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS end methods. These often take an optional encoding parameter. The encoding should be supplied if necessary, and checked to insure that it is correct.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: http response.write
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS http response.end. Insure that the correct encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Buffer.from
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS Buffer.from. If partially copying a string buffer, the byteOffset and Length parameters must take encoding and variable character lengths into account.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.writeSync
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.writeSync. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.readDir
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.readDir. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.watchFile
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.watchFile. Insure that the correct filename encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Buffer.allocUnsafe
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS buffer allocation. If text is passed, insure that the buffer is sized correctly for the texts encoding.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: buf.slice
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS buf.slice. If slicing a text buffer, the (optional) start and end points must consider unicode vs ascii etc., and the possibility of extra-wide characters.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: setEncoding - generic
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: Encodings should be double checked to confirm they are correct.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: socket.send
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS socket.send method. Can be an issue if sending a buffer of non-ascii text and specifying an offset or length. In these cases, insure that the offset/length considers possible wide-characters.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: http request.end
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS http request.end. Insure that the correct encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Buffer.alloc
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS buffer allocation. If text is passed, insure the buffer is created with the correct encoding specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.readlink
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.readlink. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fs.readSync
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: NodeJS fs.readSync. Insure that the correct file encoding is specified.

localeSensitiveMethodPatternGroup.name: Date/Time
localeSensitiveMethodPatternGroup.description: Date and Time formatting and display

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: now
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: Equivalent to (new Date).getTime()

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Date.UTC
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: UTC Date constructor

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Intl.DateTimeFormat
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: Intl.DateTimeFormat constructor

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: parseInvariant
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: Date/Number parseInvariant

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: localeFormat
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: Date/Number/String localeFormat

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: parseLocale
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: Date/Number parseLocale

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fontcolor
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: font color

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fontsize
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: font size

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: String.format
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: format is a method for String, Date, and Number classes

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: fixed
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: fixed sized font

localeSensitiveMethodPatternGroup.name: Number Format
localeSensitiveMethodPatternGroup.description: Currency and Number formatting and display

localeSensitiveMethodPattern.name: Intl.NumberFormat
localeSensitiveMethodPattern.description: Intl.NumberFormat constructor

generalPattern.name: Font name
generalPattern.description: Detect hardcoded font names. Should be locale-dependent. Need to look for specific fonts because there are many different ways that font names are used.

generalPattern.name: datetime-local
generalPattern.description: Input type to set the local date and time. The associated date format may not be locale appropriate.

generalPattern.name: Date input forms
generalPattern.description: Date input forms involve creating a Date object, with the associated i18n issues

generalPattern.name: Accept-Language
generalPattern.description: HTTP protocol Accept-Language header. You may wish to double check that the accepted languages match the application's locale requirements.

generalPattern.name: \w+\(['"]date["']\)
generalPattern.description: Methods passing date as a callback/filter/etc.

generalPattern.name: 'base64'
generalPattern.description: Type of string encoding. Accepts URL and Filename Safe Alphabet. Use unicode if non-english characters are required.

generalPattern.name: Accept-Charset
generalPattern.description: HTTP protocol Accept-Charset header. You may wish to double check that the accepted character sets match the application's locale requirements.

generalPattern.name: Unicode Character Set
generalPattern.description: References to Unicode character set encoding.

generalPattern.name: 'binary'
generalPattern.description: May be used as a way to encode buffers as latin-1 strings.

generalPattern.name: jQuery load
generalPattern.description: Loads an URL. Enable this rule if URL's must be matched with the proper locale.

generalPattern.name: Font style
generalPattern.description: The style of a font (e.g. bold, italic) may not not look good in a locale's preferred font.

generalPattern.name: ISO-Latin
generalPattern.description: References to ISO-Latin character sets. Should probably change to UTF-8

generalPattern.name: jQuery getScript
generalPattern.description: Retrieved script may need to be localized for the target locale.

generalPattern.name: charset
generalPattern.description: Character set specification. You may wish to double check that the character set(s) are appropriate for the application's locale requirements.

generalPattern.name: date:
generalPattern.description: Date formatting. Date formatting will vary between locales, and should not be hardcoded.

stringLineFilter.name: ali ext : filer div className tag
stringLineFilter.description: ali ext : filer div className tag

stringLineFilter.name: (pre_|post_)?emit('one string only', ...)
stringLineFilter.description: NodeJS emit method. Takes eventname to emit as a string. Only detects emit methods with one initial string argument (the emitted event).

stringLineFilter.name: Array index strings
stringLineFilter.description: Filters lines with strings that are array indexes. For example: entry['trade'];

stringStatementFilter.name: Multi single-word strings
stringStatementFilter.description: Filters statements with multiple single-word strings that are either lowercase, camelcase, or contain underscores/numbers/punctuation.

stringLiteralFilter.name: ali ext: filter specific file type
stringLiteralFilter.description: ali ext: filter specific file type

stringLiteralFilter.name: ali-ext: all Upper and Lower case
stringLiteralFilter.description: all Upper and Lower case with symbol/punc/num around

stringLiteralFilter.name: File extension - Source
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings that contain only a source code file extension

stringLiteralFilter.name: File extension - Source
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings that contain only a source code file extension

stringLiteralFilter.name: ali ext: filter str&number mixture. eg:41f3wiy00k5gjcp5t
stringLiteralFilter.description: ali ext: filter str&number mixture. eg:41f3wiy00k5gjcp5t

stringLiteralFilter.name: Regex (expressions|between|pipes)
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters Regex expressions. Detects strings in parenthesis separated by pipes.

stringLiteralFilter.name: Path only 1
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters paths that don't start with slash; e.g. admin/create

stringLiteralFilter.name: ID
stringLiteralFilter.description: ID alone is usually always a program element

stringLiteralFilter.name: Word starts with special char
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings that contain a word that starts with one of these

stringLiteralFilter.name: Insertions only
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings that consist only of dynamic insertions. For example: "%s"

stringLiteralFilter.name: File extension - General
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings that contain only a file extension: .xxx

stringLiteralFilter.name: HTML tags/Special chars only
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters a literal that contains only HTML tags or special characters. If it contains display text between the tags, then it is not filtered

stringLiteralFilter.name: File extension - Image
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings that contain only an image file extension

stringLiteralFilter.name: Single letter
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters single letter strings which are highly unlikely to require translation. Single Letters

stringLiteralFilter.name: Filepath
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings consisting only of filenames and paths, e.g. data\sports.cfg

stringLiteralFilter.name: Filepath or URL
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings consisting only of filepaths or URLS, e.g. c:\data\sports and http://www.lingoport.com

stringLiteralFilter.name: Path only 2
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters paths that start with slash; e.g. /admin/create

stringLiteralFilter.name: Underscored or dashed
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters underscored or dashed strings. For example: "some-word", "{some_word}", "-word"

stringLiteralFilter.name: Non-letter chars only
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings consisting entirely of non-letter characters and linefeeds

stringLiteralFilter.name: Embedded special chars
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters programmatic elements that contain any of the characters in this character-class expression

stringLiteralFilter.name: Calls to function
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filter string literals containing calls to function()

stringLiteralFilter.name: HTML Elements
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings comprised entirely of html element names.

stringLiteralFilter.name: HTML tags with insertions
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings containing HTML tags and dynamic insertions

stringLiteralFilter.name: UTF-8 encoding
stringLiteralFilter.description: UTF-8 encoding string is not translatable

stringLiteralFilter.name: Regex Expressions
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters out strings containing regex expressions. Looks for 3 or more of the following: "\b \w \s \t \. .* .+ [q-y,$etc] ^ $ \A \Z \S \P (?i)"

stringLiteralFilter.name: HTML entities
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings containing one or more HTML entities

stringLiteralFilter.name: In-quote code block
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters out the ends of in-quote code blocks

stringLiteralFilter.name: File extension - Other
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings that are one of these file extensions

stringLiteralFilter.name: Calls to factory
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filter string literals containing calls to factory()

stringLiteralFilter.name: String starts with special char
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters strings where the first word begins with one of these

stringLiteralFilter.name: Aggressive Regex
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters out strings containing regex expressions.

stringLiteralFilter.name: Camel case word
stringLiteralFilter.description: Filters camel case word (containing one or more lowercase letters followed by one or more uppercase letters)

stringMethodFilter.name: show
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to show. 'show' is a jQuery method.

stringMethodFilter.name: hide
stringMethodFilter.description: Filter only the first string passed to hide. Hide is a jQuery method.

stringMethodFilter.name: show
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to show. 'show' is a jQuery method.

stringMethodFilter.name: replace
stringMethodFilter.description: jQuery HTML/CSS Method. Replaces html elements with given html element.

stringMethodFilter.name: hide
stringMethodFilter.description: Filter only the first string passed to hide. Hide is a jQuery method.

stringMethodFilter.name: once
stringMethodFilter.description: Method once, commonly used for single events. Takes the eventname as a string.

stringMethodFilter.name: Debug - Aggressive
stringMethodFilter.description: Assumes debug and logging output remains in English; e.g. console.log("some error"). More expansive filter than 'Debug' rule.

stringMethodFilter.name: getConnections
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS server.getConnections method. May take callback as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: jQuery Object
stringMethodFilter.description: Filter strings passed to the jQuery object.

stringMethodFilter.name: AngularJS.injector
stringMethodFilter.description: AngularJS ng method. For dependency injection.

stringMethodFilter.name: AngularJS.module
stringMethodFilter.description: Module is passed the module name. This is not user facing.

stringMethodFilter.name: Property names
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters property names; getProperty, hasOwnProperty, getPropertyValue

stringMethodFilter.name: updateClass
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters strings passed to the updateClass method.

stringMethodFilter.name: classList.method
stringMethodFilter.description: Filter classList methods such as add/remove/toggle

stringMethodFilter.name: appendTo
stringMethodFilter.description: jQuery HTML/CSS Method. Contents will be html tags.

stringMethodFilter.name: $parse
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameter to AngularJS $parse function. Parameter is a string expression to compile.

stringMethodFilter.name: $animate.methods
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to AngularJS animate methods. These methods take event and class names as parameters.

stringMethodFilter.name: $resource
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to AngularJS $resource constructor.

stringMethodFilter.name: AngularJS.fromJson
stringMethodFilter.description: AngularJS ng module method. Deserializes a JSON String. Disable if JSON may contain issues.

stringMethodFilter.name: querystring.method
stringMethodFilter.description: These methods deal with URL queryStrings.

stringMethodFilter.name: $setValidity
stringMethodFilter.description: AngularJS model controller method. Takes index key to store validation message as string parameter.

stringMethodFilter.name: AngularJS.isElement
stringMethodFilter.description: AngularJS ng method. Checks if text is dom element.

stringMethodFilter.name: (un)?watch(File)?
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS File watching methods. Takes filename as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: $cacheFactory.methods
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to AngularJS cacheFactory methods. These methods take cacheIDs as string parameters.

stringMethodFilter.name: $provide.methods
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters AngularJS provider methods. These take service/constant/animation/filter names as strings.

stringMethodFilter.name: addHandler
stringMethodFilter.description: Adds a DOM handler. Passed the name of the element and the name of the event.

stringMethodFilter.name: $filterProvider.register
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to AngularJS filterProvider register method. (String parameter refers to filter function names)

stringMethodFilter.name: insertAfter
stringMethodFilter.description: jQuery HTML/CSS Method. Inserts html elements after the selected elements.

stringMethodFilter.name: AngularJS.mock.module
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters paramaters passed to AngularJS AngularJS.mock.module method.

stringMethodFilter.name: animate
stringMethodFilter.description: Filter strings passed to animate method

stringMethodFilter.name: $exceptionHandler
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to AngularJS exceptionHandler. Keep disabled if exception messages will be localized.

stringMethodFilter.name: get(Relative)?Path
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to path-retrieving functions.

stringMethodFilter.name: module
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters strings passed to module method

stringMethodFilter.name: disconnect
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS cluster.disconnect method. May take callback as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: kill
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS worker.kill method. May take signal, e.g. 'SIGTERM', as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: (dir|ext|base)name
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS path (ext|dir|base)name methods. Take paths as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: element.methods
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to methods used to interact with DOM elements.

stringMethodFilter.name: $httpBackend.methods
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters paramaters passed to AngularJS $httpBackend methods.

stringMethodFilter.name: spawn
stringMethodFilter.description: Filter parameters passed to NodeJS child_process.spawn.

stringMethodFilter.name: removeClass
stringMethodFilter.description: Filter strings passed to removeClass method

stringMethodFilter.name: assert\w*
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters strings passed to assertion style methods, such as assertEquals.

stringMethodFilter.name: ajaxObject.(open|setRequestHeader)
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters strings passed to ajaxObject methods.

stringMethodFilter.name: Debug
stringMethodFilter.description: Assumes debug and logging output remains in English; e.g. console.log("some error")

stringMethodFilter.name: Listener
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to Listener methods

stringMethodFilter.name: AngularJS.module(something).method
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters strings passed to AngularJS module methods.

stringMethodFilter.name: $filter
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameter passed to AngularJS filter constructor. Parameter is the name of the filter function to retrieve.

stringMethodFilter.name: $animateProvider.register
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters AngularJS animateProvider register method. Method takes the name of an animation as a parameter.

stringMethodFilter.name: exec(File)?(Sync)?
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS child_process.exec/execFile/execSync/execFileSync. Takes command/file to execute as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: createConnection
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS createConnection method. Takes callback as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: wrapAll
stringMethodFilter.description: jQuery HTML/CSS Methods. Wraps specified html elements around all selected elements.

stringMethodFilter.name: listenerCount
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS event listenerCount method. Takes event name as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: $cacheFactory
stringMethodFilter.description: AngularJS ng method. Takes name of cache object.

stringMethodFilter.name: setFlagsFromString
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS v8.setFlagsFromString method. Takes flags as strings.

stringMethodFilter.name: attr
stringMethodFilter.description: Filter strings passed to attr method

stringMethodFilter.name: setupMaster
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS cluster.setupMaster. Takes a list of settings as strings.

stringMethodFilter.name: remove(All)?Listener(s)?
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS event methods. Take eventName argument as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: hashPrefix
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to AngularJS locationProvider hashPrefix method.

stringMethodFilter.name: (add|remove|prepend)?(Once|All)?[Ll]istener[s]?
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS event methods. Take eventName argument as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: vm.methods
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS virtualmachine methods. Take code to run as a parameter.

stringMethodFilter.name: isElement
stringMethodFilter.description: Is the given item a DOM element?

stringMethodFilter.name: (pre_|post_)?emit
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS emit method. Takes eventname to emit as a string. Only detects emit methods with one initial string argument (the emitted event).

stringMethodFilter.name: prepend(Once)?Listener
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS event methods. Take eventName argument as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: $xhrFactory
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to AngularJS xhrFactory constructor.

stringMethodFilter.name: path.join
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to path join methods. Note that this method is detected as a local sensitive method and must still be handled.

stringMethodFilter.name: execFile
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS execFile method. Takes command to execute as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: Debug
stringMethodFilter.description: Assumes debug and logging output remains in English; e.g. console.log("some error")

stringMethodFilter.name: $sceDelegate.(trustAs|maybeTrusted)
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters to AngularJS sceDelegate trustAs and maybeTrusted methods.

stringMethodFilter.name: wrapInner
stringMethodFilter.description: jQuery HTML/CSS Methods. Wraps specified html elements around inner HTML of each selected element.

stringMethodFilter.name: spawnSync
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to NodeJS child_process.spawnSync.

stringMethodFilter.name: $injector.(has|get)
stringMethodFilter.description: AngularJS $injector has|get methods. Take name of service/instance and caller name.

stringMethodFilter.name: httpOptions
stringMethodFilter.description: AngularJS JS ng templateRequestProvider method. Takes array of strings defining http options.

stringMethodFilter.name: wrap
stringMethodFilter.description: jQuery HTML/CSS Methods. Wraps specified html elements around selected element.

stringMethodFilter.name: prependTo
stringMethodFilter.description: jQuery HTML/CSS Method. Contents will be html tags.

stringMethodFilter.name: HTTP header methods
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters strings passed to addRequestHeader and setRequestHeader

stringMethodFilter.name: isString
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters strings passed to isString method.

stringMethodFilter.name: addClass
stringMethodFilter.description: Filter strings passed to addClass method

stringMethodFilter.name: $normalize
stringMethodFilter.description: AngularJS ng method. Converts string to camelCase.

stringMethodFilter.name: connect
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS net.connect method. May take options as strings.

stringMethodFilter.name: Programmatic string methods
stringMethodFilter.description: String parameters are not UI strings

stringMethodFilter.name: $componentController
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters paramaters passed to AngularJS $componentController constructor.

stringMethodFilter.name: removeData
stringMethodFilter.description: jQuery Misc Method. String contents are the name of the element to remove.

stringMethodFilter.name: zlib.methods
stringMethodFilter.description: NodeJS zlib methods. For creating and unpacking archives. May take options and/or a callback as strings.

stringMethodFilter.name: $routeProvider.methods
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters paramaters passed to AngularJS $routeProvider methods.

stringMethodFilter.name: event
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to event. 'event' is a jQuery method.

stringMethodFilter.name: insertBefore
stringMethodFilter.description: jQuery HTML/CSS Method. Inserts html elements before the selected elements.

stringMethodFilter.name: $provide.factory
stringMethodFilter.description: AngularJS ng provider method. Takes service name as string.

stringMethodFilter.name: $provide.(factory|service|value|decorator)
stringMethodFilter.description: AngularJS provide methods. Take service name as string argument.

stringMethodFilter.name: parse
stringMethodFilter.description: Assumes no UI strings; e.g. JSON.parse("true")

stringMethodFilter.name: css and html methods
stringMethodFilter.description: Strings passed to these methods are not UI strings

stringMethodFilter.name: $controller
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to AngularJS controller constructor. Constructor may take controller name.

stringMethodFilter.name: fork
stringMethodFilter.description: Filter parameters passed to NodeJS child_process.fork.

stringMethodFilter.name: $compileProvider.directive
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters strings passed to AngularJS compileProvider directive method.

stringMethodFilter.name: replaceAll
stringMethodFilter.description: jQuery HTML/CSS Method. Replaces html elements with given html element.

stringMethodFilter.name: $controllerProvider.allMethods
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters parameters passed to AngularJS controllerProvider methods. (String parameters refer to controller names)

stringMethodFilter.name: $(emit|broadcast)
stringMethodFilter.description: Filters AngularJS emit and broadcast messages. These take an eventname parameter and broadcast that eventname to listeners.

stringOperandFilter.name: index
stringOperandFilter.description: Assume indices are not displayed in UI

stringOperandFilter.name: textOverflow
stringOperandFilter.description: textOverflow will not displayed on frontend

stringOperandFilter.name: version
stringOperandFilter.description: version may not displayed on frontend

stringOperandFilter.name: Names
stringOperandFilter.description: Assume names are not displayed in UI

stringOperandFilter.name: Class
stringOperandFilter.description: Filters class values, e.g. numberClass = "[object Number]"

stringOperandFilter.name: sql
stringOperandFilter.description: Filters strings assigned to SQL-named variables.

stringOperandFilter.name: query
stringOperandFilter.description: Ignore strings assigned to query variables.

stringOperandFilter.name: ID
stringOperandFilter.description: Filters strings assigned/compared to ID variables; id="main" or TRACK_ID="start" or parentId="unknown"

stringOperandFilter.name: (console.)?sessionId
stringOperandFilter.description: Session ID's are unlikely to be shown to users.

stringOperandFilter.name: Debug Variables
stringOperandFilter.description: Ignore debug/logging variable contents. Assumes debug and logging output remains in English.

methodLineFilter.name: logger methods
methodLineFilter.description: logger will not displayed on frontend

methodLineFilter.name: log methods
methodLineFilter.description: log methods will not displayed on frontend

methodLineFilter.name: replace.method
methodLineFilter.description: replace method will not shown in frontend

methodLineFilter.name: indexOf method
methodLineFilter.description: literal inside indexOf method will not shown in frontend

methodLineFilter.name: num(ber)?.toString
methodLineFilter.description: May be used to convert number to different base.

methodLineFilter.name: Serialized object toString
methodLineFilter.description: Ignore toString methods on serialized objects.

methodLineFilter.name: path\.join\(
methodLineFilter.description: Ignore joined paths (many false positives from 'join' LSM)

methodLineFilter.name: JSON.parse
methodLineFilter.description: JSON Parsing - Most likely a false positive

staticFileLineFilter.name: css and html methods
staticFileLineFilter.description: Filter javascript css and html methods, e.g. element.css(styles)
